basics.description:
**Important:** _This Azure Sentinel Solution is currently in public preview. This feature is provided without a service level agreement, and it's not recommended for production workloads. Certain features might not be supported or might have constrained capabilities. For more information, see [Supplemental Terms of Use for Microsoft Azure Previews](https://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/)._

**Note:** _There may be [known issues](https://aka.ms/sentinelsolutionsknownissues) pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing._

Azure Sentinel Solutions provide a consolidated way to acquire Azure Sentinel content like data connectors, workbooks, analytics, and automations in your workspace with a single deployment step.

**Workbooks:** 2, **Analytic Rules:** 3, **Watchlists:** 1, **Playbooks:** 3, **Function Apps:** 1

[Learn more about Azure Sentinel](https://aka.ms/azuresentinel) | [Learn more about Solutions](https://aka.ms/azuresentinelsolutionsdoc)

metadata.hidden: Hiding location, we get it from the log analytics workspace

basics.name: getLAWorkspace
basics.toolTip: This filters by workspaces that exist in the Resource Group selected

basics.name: workspace
basics.label: Workspace
basics.toolTip: This dropdown will list only workspace that exists in the Resource Group selected

options.text: > Make sure that youâ€™ve connected the 'Azure Activity' and 'Azure Key Vault' data connectors in your Azure Sentinel workspace.
Register an AAD app for the function app that will create honeytokens in your key vaults at scale.
Enter a meaningful name for your function app:

elements.name: funcappname
elements.label: Function app name
elements.toolTip: Enter a name that is unique, between 2-22 characters long, and includes alphanumeric characters only.

constraints.validationMessage: Must be between 2 and 22 characters in length, alphanumeric and not end with a hyphen.

options.text: 2. Run the following command from a cloud shell:
[concat('curl -sL https://aka.ms/sentinelhoneytokensappcreate | bash -s ', if(equals(steps('prereq').AADregister.funcappname,''),'<your-app-name>',steps('prereq').AADregister.funcappname))]
Click here to open a cloud shell
3. Provide the output from the cloud shell below:

elements.name: aadClientId
elements.label: AAD Client ID
elements.toolTip: Please enter the AAD Client ID

constraints.validationMessage: Please enter the AAD Client ID

elements.name: aadClientSecret
elements.label: AAD Client Secret
elements.toolTip: Please enter the AAD Client Secret

constraints.validationMessage: Please enter the AAD Client Secret

options.text: 4. Grant admin consent to your function app.

link.label: Click here to continue in your function app settings.

options.text: This Azure Sentinel Solution installs workbooks. Workbooks provide a flexible canvas for data monitoring, analysis, and the creation of rich visual reports within the Azure portal. They allow you to tap into one or many data sources from Azure Sentinel and combine them into unified interactive experiences.
A workbook that displays details about all honeytoken activity in your key vaults.
Provides an interactive, guided process for deploying honeytokens to your key vaults. Share this workbook with all key vault owners in your tenant.

This Azure Sentinel Solution installs analytic rules for HoneyTokens that you can enable for custom alert generation in Azure Sentinel. These analytic rules will be deployed in disabled mode in the analytics rules gallery of your Azure Sentinel workspace. Configure and enable these rules in the analytic rules gallery after this Solution deploys.
Detects when a honeytoken key has been accessed.
Detects when a honeytoken secret has been accessed.

elements.name: analytic3
elements.label: HoneyTokens: KeyVault HoneyToken diagnostic settings deleted or changed

options.text: Detects when a monitored key vault diagnostics settings are deleted or changed.

Azure Sentinel watchlists enable the collection of data from external data sources for correlation with the events in your Azure Sentinel environment. Once created, you can use watchlists in your search, detection rules, threat hunting, and response playbooks. Watchlists are stored in your Azure Sentinel workspace as name-value pairs and are cached for optimal query performance and low latency. Once deployment is successful, the installed watchlists will be available in the Watchlists blade under 'My Watchlists'.
Display a list of honeytokens created in your tenant's key vaults.

This solution installs playbook resources.  A security playbook is a collection of procedures that can be run from Azure Sentinel in response to an alert. A security playbook can help automate and orchestrate your response, and can be run manually or set to run automatically when specific alerts are triggered. Security playbooks in Azure Sentinel are based on Azure Logic Apps, which means that you get all the power, customizability, and built-in templates of Logic Apps. Each playbook is created for the specific subscription you choose, but when you look at the Playbooks page, you will see all the playbooks across any selected subscriptions.
Internally called from the managemnent workbook to display which key-vaults are monitored by the SOC.
Internally called from the managemnent workbook during the manual honeytokens deployment to add a honeytoken to the SOC's watchlist.
Internally called from the managemnent workbook to generate an ARM template for adding or removing a user from a key-vault's policy.
This solution installs Azure Functions.
Define a function app to deploy honeytokens in your key vaults at scale

elements.name: playbook4-ServicePlan
elements.label: Service plan
elements.placeholder: Select a service plan for your function app
elements.toolTip: Select a service plan for Azure function app that will deploy honeytokens at scale. This function app requires permissions to your key vault on behalf of the user running the function app. The Premium plan has a higher cost, and allows you to configure extra security features, such as assigning the function a specific IP/domain.

options.text: Define values for the key vault where you'll store your AAD app's ID and secret.

elements.name: playbook4-NewOrExistingKV
elements.label: Should a new KeyVault be created
elements.placeholder: New key vault or use existing?
elements.toolTip: Select whether to create a new key vault to store the app secret, or to deploy to an existing key vault

elements.name: existingKV
elements.label: Existing key vault
elements.toolTip: Select a key vault from the list

elements.name: playbook4-KeyVaultName
elements.label: New key vault name
elements.toolTip: Enter a name for your new key vault

constraints.validationMessage: Enter a name for your new key vault

elements.name: playbook4-ResourceGroupOfKeyVaultStoringAppSecret
elements.label: New key vault resource group
elements.toolTip: Select a resource group for your new key vault

elements.name: playbook4-SecretName
elements.label: Key vault secret name
elements.toolTip: Enter a name for the key vault secret where you want to store your app secret

constraints.validationMessage: Enter a name for the key vault secret where you want to store your app secret

options.text: Define settings used for the keys and secrets used in your honeytokens.

elements.name: playbook4-keysKeywords
elements.label: Honeytoken key keywords
elements.toolTip: A comma-separated lists of alphanumeric values you want to use with your honeytoken names. For example, key,prod,dev

constraints.validationMessage: Please enter a comma-separated list of prefixes to be used for keys (no spaces)

elements.name: playbook4-secretsKeywords
elements.label: Honeytoken secret keywords
elements.toolTip: A comma-separated list of alphanumeric values you want to use with your honeytoken secrets. For example, secret,prod,dev

constraints.validationMessage: Please enter a comma-separated list of prefixes to be used for secrets (no spaces)

elements.name: playbook4-AdditionalHTProb
elements.label: Additional honeytoken probability
elements.toolTip: The probability of more than one honeytoken being added to the Key Vault.  Enter a value between 0 and 1, such as 0.6.

constraints.validationMessage: Please enter a number between 0 and 1

elements.name: policyDefs
elements.label: Recommend honeytoken deployment via Azure Security Center (optional)

options.text: Raise a custom recommendation in Azure Security Center to deploy honeytokens in all key vaults for a specified management group.
Use the links provided on the 'Output' page after the solution installation is complete to deploy the 'Deception' policy and raise your custom recommendations.
